website_summaries.verdict: This is a compact manual pump that’s great for on-the-go and it’s also perfect for capturing letdown.
pros: Works just as quickly as an electric pump and is simple enough to throw in diaper bag
Made of quality materials and is durable
Comes with a convenient stopper and carrying case
Ensures no milk is wasted while baby feeds
cons: Ounces measurement on pump may be a bit off

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This little pump is awesome. I have a 1 month old and I started using this a few days ago to try to start a freezer stash. I pump one side while the baby nurses on the other, and I’m getting 2-3+ounces each time. It’s so much easier to clean than an electric pump, and it takes less time away from the baby. I’m seriously considering buying a second one for when I’m eventually away from the baby.
customer_reviews.author: LaReinaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm super excited about this product. With some of the challenges I'm facing with feeding my baby this has allowed me to get the most out of the milk I'm producing in the hopes to keep my production up. I was impressed on how well it works. While feeding on one side I place it on the other. In one feeding I was able to extract a full ounce. The other evening I extracted 80ml for both sides combined. I'm not real impressed with the lid but the stopper seems to work ok.
customer_reviews.author: Josh & Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my bumblebee! It’s way cheaper than the haakaa and just as effective. I have twins. One is exclusively breastfed and the othe drinks expressed milk. This has help my bottle fed baby so much! He was about 1/2 formula fed, but with this, he hardly has to drink formula! I get about 1-2 oz every feed, which is about an extra 12-20 oz a day. Just bought a second one bc sometimes I don’t get the time to clean it between feeds and miss out on milk.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Great haakaa
customer_reviews.text: Love this haakaa, the stopper is so cute and super useful, it really keeps the milk from leaking out. This came with the haakaa, a lid, a stopper and a super cute drawstring bag for storage. You just need warm soapy water to clean before and after use. Haakaas are great to use while nursing on the breast you are not feeding on. They are also small and great for just tossing into your diaper bag. Once you see how easy it is to use your will not want to be without it.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and milk.
customer_reviews.text: After over a month of trying to use this I still get the same failed outcome. It won't stay! Sure, it will collect milk. But what's the point if the suction is so bad it falls off and spills everywhere. Buy the real thing. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best product!
customer_reviews.text: This has been my lifesaver with nursing my little one! I’ve nursed two other babies, my first until 3 months and second until 6 months, but never exclusively I always had to supplement with formula. Thanks to this I’ve been able to catch my letdown on the opposite side and save about 2oz each feed and have not had to supplement! This is one of my most used baby products! And swear by it! This one is low cost and has everything the major name brand one has, but in my opinion you can get two of these instead of one of theirs and these work just as good! I will be purchasing one more!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy_of_Three

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and is good for catching the let down IF your kid stays completely still. My son has kicked it off a few times spilling liquid gold all over the place. I've tried a few different methods for getting it to stay on and honestly, none of them work. And after 10-15 minutes of it being suctioned to my boob and MAybe not falling off, it hurts like hell.theres always a ring around my areola and it's uncomfortable. It came highly recommended but it's not for me. The bag however is super cute and the perfect size for travel bottles, pacifiers etc..
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: Best manual pump.  Hands free- fill a bottle and a baby at the same time.
customer_reviews.text: Best manual pump. Hands free, great for breastfeeding on one side and catching about 4 oz on the other. I don't have to even touch it that much- I recommend having your hands available the first few times you use this, it fell off the first time I used it when it was full. Not fun. But I've been using it almost every day and it hasn't happened since. If you want to be efficient while nursing, use this. I can fill a bottle and fill a baby at the same time without using hands :) Great for big busts - 38 G. I also use this with my single elvie pump and it's a great pair up.
customer_reviews.author: Celestiafae

customer_reviews.title: I was not in love with this product
customer_reviews.text: I was not in love with this product. I did get about an ounce of letdown, but my nipples were super sore from the suction after using. It wouldn’t suction enough to empty either. So trying to feed and suction is a little cumbersome. Probably won’t use again and wouldn’t recommend to a friend. I did still give it 3 stars because if it did work well for you the bag is cute, the toppers cute and it seems of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mir18

customer_reviews.title: My only regret is that I didn't purchase sooner
customer_reviews.text: Mommas add this to your nursing stash-PRONTO. Although, I love my Spectra S2 it's a little time consuming to clean at times caring for a newborn & dog alone while my husband is deployed. I was on the market for something quicker to clean & easier to travel with. I am SO happy I happened upon this. Not only is cleanup quicker I'm able to pump more conveniently & quietly (my little one is a light sleeper). Not to mention it's extremely portable. I've used this driving, taking my dog out & while feeding my little one in the morning. My only regret is that I didn't purchase sooner. My milk stash would've been tripled by now.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: My BFF
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer for breastfeeding mamas! I wish I’d had one for my previous two babies! If you HATE electric pumps with as much passion as I do, building an emergency freezer stash is a chore. With this, I just catch the sympathetic letdown from whichever side doesn’t have a nursing baby. I’ll passively and painlessly collect 1-3 oz each time we nurse. I love it. Best tool in my breastfeeding toolbox. The only problem is I’ve just now realized how much milk I wasted into burp cloths before discovering this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Clapp

customer_reviews.title: Equivalent to other similar pumps for a better price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in place of a Hakaa. It worked really well, even staying on while walking around a bit. The suction wasn't as strong as I expected, thinking it would pull more milk, but as I read more about it apparently it is only a steady suction to make you "leak". I unfortunately only got to use it for a couple of week before I had complications due to medication drying up my milk supply. When I was using it I very happy with it though!
customer_reviews.author: B.Fish

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful except...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! You have to fold the flange backwards and squeeze it before attaching and then pull the flange back forward in order to get a good suction going. I don’t use it as a hand pump but rather as a milk saver while I nurse the other side. I have saved SO much milk with this! The only reason why I’m knocking off a star is because the measurements are super inaccurate! It’s off by at least 1.5 fl oz! I pour my milk into a bag before freezing so I do end up getting a true measurement off the bag, but I don’t understand why this can’t just have the correct measurements on it?
customer_reviews.author: Online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction, leaks!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to save a little money by purchasing this as it’s a little less than the name-brand suction pump. I wanted a second/back-up. Unfortunately this is less rigid silicone and in my experience didn’t work nearly as well. I used it a couple of times and both times the suction broke (and I was unaware) and my boob leaked all over my clothes resulting in both a loss of precious breast milk and soaked clothing. I use my name-brand suction pump multiple times per day and have never had this issue. I threw this pump in the trash; I’d rather wash my other pump more often then deal with this crappy one.
customer_reviews.author: Coco Bowerman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent non mechanical option
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean, small and compact, and is pretty effective. The only down sides are that: 1. It holds about 2-3 ounces at a time without spilling. 2. It will obviously fall off if it's wet before you apply it or if you bounce it hard enough. 3. Does not make for good storage as neither the plug or the cap fit securely. But all in all it does exactly what it's advertised to do. I recommend this for travel and around the home use but if you need something that pumps a lot at once or that can store milk for extended periods, try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rojae

customer_reviews.title: Bumblebee vs Haakaa
customer_reviews.text: I have three silicone manual breast pumps. I love them and use them at every feeding which is 8 times a day. This bumble bee one actually has a weaker suction compared to the Haakaa. It feels like its made with a slightly softer silicon material, hence less suction power. (just a subjective observation) Order of preference: 150 mL Haakaa when it's been 4 + hrs since last feed, 100 mL Haakaa and last this Bumblebee one. Also this Bumblebee pump doesn't have the suction on the bottom so it's more prone to tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money!
customer_reviews.text: After already having the Hakka and needing another I didn’t want to spend that much again. I found these bumblebee pumps and am so happy I tried them out. They are lighter than the Hakka and don’t have quite the suction power of the Hakka but I didn’t need that much suction. They do hold slightly less than the Hakka but it’s enough for me at just under four ounces. Plus it comes with the stopper! The stopper will prevent leaks if you bump it over on the table but will not stop leaks if you drop it in the floor. Trust me. Still better than nothing! And this is the best price!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ryott

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Item!!!
customer_reviews.text: This does not work. I have 3 different suction pumps and this is the only one that did not work at all. I bought a cheap one at walmart that had better suction. Even the Haakaa had better suction than this. I am not happy. I followed all the steps gave it a few days and still nothing. Its extremely weak and definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: MzShaniBerle

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the name brand Hakaa!
customer_reviews.text: Oh how I love this thing! I was losing so much milk when I’d nurse or pump on the opposite side. Pumping bras never seem to fit right in me, so I was usually stuck with no free hand as I pumped both sides at once, or stuck with a wet pants leg and wasted milk when I pumped one side at a time. With this, I just stick it on and catch whatever milk leaks out. You’d be surprised how much it can catch! It’ll make you wonder how you let that much go before! Very easy to use and clean. Love the cute little stopper and caddy for fridge storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bleau

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This did not help at all. I'm not sure if it's something about its shape or the way it's made, but it would never collect any milk.
customer_reviews.author: Ashmarie

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay on
customer_reviews.text: Won't stay on and baby kept knocking it. She's 6 months and fills my lap pretty well so maybe there's just not enough room to also have this thing hanging off my boob. It really wasn't collecting much milk but maybe that's b/c we're really established in BF and I don't have a crazy let down anymore. Not sure, but not for us! Was hoping it would help us store a bit more in the freezer but nah...I'd rather pump once and get 10 times as much as this pump collects.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay on.  Missing items advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a dud, but mine did not work. Tried different ways to put it on but it fell off each time. Also, I did not receive all items advertised. I did not get the bag or dust cover. Overall not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Avriel R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I did not read instructions so as you can imagine, failed to use this product correctly. However, even with using this improperly (I merely got it to attach / suction to me - I did not push on the bulb to create a suction) I was able to catch 3 ounces during a feeding (photo attached) - this was a 10 minute feeding. This product is amazing! It is very easy to use whether you read the instructions or not. It isn't loud like your typical pump and it's extremely easy to clean. I have also found that fhe fluted opening makes it extremely easy to pour into milk storage bags.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Great stash starter!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!!! I noticed when I would nurse; at night specifically, I leaked from the other breast. I heard about the hakaa but ordered this since it was less expensive. One of the best purchases! Since I’m a SAHM I feed on demand and this is a great way to start a freezer stash for those times where I need someone to watch the baby. I would keep a bag in the fridge and fill it for 2 days from what I would get each night then stick it in the freezer. Great suction, I use it while feeding in the side lying position. Easy to clean with a bottle brush too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at first now I am disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It starts out great but it seems like it is wearing out. I clean them extremely well and dry them. I turn the top rim over squeeze it and apply it pulling the top rim back over to make it stay. Well like I said it semms like they are worn out! My baby is only 4 months old and needed them to last longer. I have 2 of them that I have in rotation neither of them are working right. Won't stay on so there is no suction and they fall off
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Kimmel

customer_reviews.title: Choose the Haakaa instead
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my haakaa brand cup but wanted a lid and stopper. The price of a haakaa lid was about as much as this whole kit so I figured I’d snag this brand for all of the extra goodies. However, the suction is horrible on this one. I think the haakaa must have a patent on an extra ring on lip of the suction area, whereas this one does not have that ring. If my baby or I barely bump it, It falls off my breast and we’re both covered in milk. At this point I just use the little stopper insert.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other brands; prone to losing suction
customer_reviews.text: I found that mine did not stay on well after using it for less than a month, especially after trying one I got from another company. The suction would let go and I have spilled milk,or almost spilled it. I still run my pump stuff through a sterilizer, so the trick to boil it wouldn't seem to apply. The calibrations were also WAY off. I'm not expecting them to be super accurate, but had just over an ounce the other day and noticed it was at the 2 oz mark! At this point I only use this one as a back up when the other pump I bought needs to be cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible suction compared to the Haaakaa
customer_reviews.text: I bought the original haakaa a few days after my baby was born, I LOVED it! I decided to order another one. I went for this one because I figured it couldn’t be that different... I was so wrong! This pumps suction is horrible compared to the haakaa! I use both at the same time and this one always falls off and spills. Sometimes while I’m feeding, it scares my baby with the noise it makes when it falls. I guess if you’ve never tried the haaakaa, you wouldn’t be able to compare and this would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Susana Escobedo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible suction.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it’d work good after reading reviews but it was terrible! I have the actual haakaa brand and it works amazingly. The suction on this is complete trash. I could barley get an oz out even if my breasts were engorged. I’d use my Haakaa and get 4+ oz every time. I only kept it bc I loved the little bag it came with as well as the stopper and dust cap.
customer_reviews.author: Cammie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pump!
customer_reviews.text: I love This! It’s ideal if you’re exclusively breastfeeding- just catches and encouraged letdown while nursing - I use the milk to keep a small bottle on hand in case the baby is thirsty while we are out- I’ve also collected it and frozen some for emergencies! It takes zero effort or extra time which is essential when you have other kids to care for!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I pumped almost about 60mL with this :) I bought it because I don’t feel like getting up in the middle of night using my electric breast pump. Also, this help be occupied with doing other things to like I can watch my baby if being fussy. Or I can just enjoy reading a book just let the Hakka do it works.This is so easy to just bend the fold down and put the nipple in the middle of it. Then squeeze the middle to suction everything in place. I love how it came with a lid for me to close it! Perfect a must buy if breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Buy This!!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time tonight. It is SO easy to use. My baby is a newborn (4 weeks) so they eat about 2-3 oz every feed on average. I was able to save over an ounce of breastmilk on a single feed and I think that’s great! It’ll definitely help me build up my stash for when I have to go back to work. Definitely worth it. Buy this, you won’t regret it! Wish I had gotten it sooner because I hate pumping and this will allow me to do it a little less during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I got a 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: You’re most likely asking yourself why this vs the Haakaa. They are actually pretty different. The bumble bee is significantly smaller than the Haakaa. So it’s easier to wear when nursing on the other side. Doesn’t drag your boob down more than it needs to. Perfect if your let down is <2oz. But if your letdown is like 4oz or something, Haakaa is probably better. The only reason for the 4 star is I have knocked this over a few times. I wish it had the bottom suction thing like the way the Haakaa has.
customer_reviews.author: EastCoastGirl

customer_reviews.title: Every First Time Mom Needs This!
customer_reviews.text: Never used something like this with my previous babies so when my friend raved about it, I knew I had to try it. It’s been a lifesaver!! My daughter is 4 weeks old and I’ve already built up a 70 oz stash without ever pumping! She’s been sleeping longer stretches now so it helps when Im engorged or even on our routine trips between NC and VA. I’m buying another to keep in my bag and have handy when I go back to work in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use ... frustrating trying to use it.. don’t recommend
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great set !
customer_reviews.text: Works just as great as the original Haaka! No issues with it. I purchased this because I needed an extra silicone pump because I always managed to forget it at grandmas house and I can’t seem to live without these since It has helped me build up a lil freezer stash for when I work/run errands. Love that it comes with the lids both for temporary storage or just to keep it from spilling which has happened to me a lot before but not anymore. The little bag is cute although I feel like something along the lines of a reusable ziplock bag maybe would have been better for cleanliness but that’s just what I like using personally
customer_reviews.author: Lizette

customer_reviews.title: Way better than "trigger" style manual pumps
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but tried this after trying about four different "trigger" style pumps which used to make my hands cramp. I have since bought and given away a number of these because they are amaze-balls! yeah, they fill quickly (a good thing) so have to do a couple times (mild inconvenience). they do not hurt like the trigger ones and are easy for someone like me with nerve damage in my hands to use. TRY IT. it's only about $10-15 so what do you have to loose?
customer_reviews.author: Grace A.

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to the name brand!
customer_reviews.text: Yay! I lost or gave away my previous haakaa so I needed a new one and decided to give this a try! Very cute and works just the same! I see some reviews saying the measurements are off... well so was my haakaa but I just always used the same bags to measure my milk so it wasn’t a big deal. Measuring was more important when I was using formula but breast milk I just wait until my bag is full then freeze it! This is a great great and you get all the accessories so I’m happy with this buy!
customer_reviews.author: sachet

customer_reviews.title: Nice for around the house use
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended trying a manual pump that naturally suctions while my son nursed on the other side. This product works as expected. I like to use mine when I’m around the house. It suctions well and collects a good amount of milk. I love that it came with a storage bag to keep all the items together so I can grab it and go. The stopper and lid were a great addition to seal the milk until I’m ready to pour it in a bottle. I’m happy with this product and have already recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Gordi

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Has helped saved what would have been wasted milk.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Has helped saved what would have been wasted milk. I use several times throughout the day when I am nursing my son. I will use the section pump on the other breast and typically get 2.5 oz to 3oz in each setting just from catching the "dripping" milk. With my first son that was the amount I would pump with my electric pump. If the section feels like too much you can squeeze and it with loosen up. Most important advice is fold over the lip before placing on your breast to get better placement and fit.
customer_reviews.author: A.Ellgen

customer_reviews.title: Breastfeeding GAME CHANGER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I bought myself before having our new baby!!! I am exclusively breastfeeding our one week old and without pumping, just attaching this on one side while baby eats on the other, I collect about 13oz a day! I already have a huge supply built up, considering it’s the first week!!! The first few times I used it, I could have cried at how much milk I got! Breastfeeding GAME CHANGER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond obsessed with this product! The bumble bee Manuel breastpump is legit the best product to attach to your breast when feeding from the other side. The first day my milk came in my breast were emgorged and uncomfortable. So everytime I would feed I would attach it to the opposite breast and just let it do it’s thing. I was able to save 10 oz of milk by doing nothing!! I’m seriously thinking about getting another!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Rink

customer_reviews.title: Does not “pump”
customer_reviews.text: Does not “pump” your breast. Helps with engorged breasts that are leaking but not so much a pump. I watched all the videos too. I got an ounce when I was “fully filled” but nothing I couldn’t do by hand. Gave us a good laugh though!
customer_reviews.author: Heather T

customer_reviews.title: Great for easily growing milk stores
customer_reviews.text: Suction power is great for not having to actually pump. I put it on 1 side while feeding on the other and then switch. This way I get foremilk and hindmilk. I average 3-4oz at a time and have to get out my electric pump way less. Its easy to use and clean- especially when exhausted. It makes storing up so easy. Love the accessories it comes with. I also recommend collection cups for letdown. I can usually get about an ounce on each side from those.
customer_reviews.author: AppleMama

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: I used this once, your breast have to be the perfect fullness for this to suction correctly. I was so excited to get this product because it’s too hard to pump and latch at same time but I would let down so much I wanted to try and save it. It only worked once for me. If you are able to get this to stay on your breast it does actually do the job. Easy to clean machine washable but I washed by hand to ensure soap was completely out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia cain

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!! Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of time and money. I have watched YouTube videos and googled ways to use this “pump”. It won’t even stay on your breast. The suction is weak and it doesn’t collect any milk. Maybe 2 cc and you better hope it doesn’t lose suction and fall off your breast causing you to lose the drop you just work hard to get
customer_reviews.author: Carletta jives

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are breastfeeding, buy this product! I have both the Bumblebee and the famed Haakaa, I prefer the Bumblebee! This "pump" is so easy to use, especially one handed. My little one is 3 weeks old and I already have a milk stash started because this product catches the let down. I use this on the other breast when my little one is nursing. You do not need to pump at all, simply suction it to your breast. It helps ease engorgement when the feeding are a hours apart.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Haylor

customer_reviews.title: Buy this to help stockpile your milk! Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I bought this one because it was slightly cheaper than the Haaka. Then my sister in law sent me the haaka. I feel like the Bumblebee is easier to attach and fits a little bit better to my breast. They are on the much larger size right now Ddd. Between upping my water intake to 120 oz. a day plus using this device during daytime feedings I pull about 4 oz each time. I have over 40 oz of breast milk stored and I have only been using this for about 4 days. Love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Brian White

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy! Get it you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little invention! I was a little skeptical at first, but read a lot of reviews and decided to go for it! So basically it is a small suction cup that catches all the extra milk that your pad absorbs on let down while you’re feeding on the opposite breast! Super easy to use, you can have it in your purse and use it anywhere. I wouldn’t get rid of your electric pump overall, but this definitely is a great accessory to it and can save you time! My picture is my let down from 1 feeding! I massaged my breast a few times as well as pressed on the pump a few times 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm no sure if I got a defective one but this did not work at all I kept having to readjust the suction on it and still wasn't getting any milk
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t pump but I wanted something to help with Engorgement When my milk came in and when I wanted to collect a little milk if we wanted to go out for a night. This was perfect! I love how compact and easy to store it is. So easy to clean too. It comes with two lids, instructions on how to use it and a nice little bag to store it in. This will also come in handy if I ever do need to pump for a special occasion. I love this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for increasing Supply!
customer_reviews.text: Although I was skeptical about how much milk this “pump“ would actually catch (I was so sure it was only going to catch a couple of drops) I was pleasantly surprised! First time I used it on the opposite breast I was nursing on during a 15 minute feed and I got almost 2 oz! Or so I thought. Here comes the reason for the one missing star from my rating. Although the silicone pump showed I “pumped” about 50 oz, in reality it was only about 30 (see photos). Besides that this works amazing and I would highly recommend it. I am ordering two more so that I can have them on rotation at each feeding!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Pop it on the other side when nursing, catch your gold
customer_reviews.text: It's super simple to use, no millions of parts to take apart and sanitize. If you can get your baby to leave it alone while nursing on the other side, you can suction it and forget about it for a little bit. I'm not that lucky, so I keep a hand on it while my son tries to pry it off, but I still get a few ounces without really trying and I use it to add to my homemade baby food. Much better than soaking my shirt or nursing pad! It can get quite a bit of suction if you want, too. Basically however hard you suction it. I like it SO much better than my Medela hand pump!
customer_reviews.author: beenwise

customer_reviews.title: recommended. easy, convenient, compact
customer_reviews.text: works well to help collect some milk while breastfeeding. it does get in the way a little, as in sometimes it's poking the baby in the belly, while I'm feeding from the other breast. but as long as it's not a big giant pump bottle and machine attached while I'm feeding the baby, I'm all for it. it also helped to keep my supply up by making my body think i was using more than i was right from the beginning. definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: mishy177

customer_reviews.title: Genius
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool product. I use it especially at night to capture the letdown of the opposite breast while baby is nursing, I can capture up to 2oz and store it for later. It uses a suction, like negative pressure, to draw out the milk. The trick is to squeeze it before you place it on the breast and probably give it another squeeze to continue suction before baby is finished feeding. Some people complained about baby knocking it off and spilling, I occasionally use it with pumping bra to hold it in place
customer_reviews.author: Allison Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Generally Haakka is the best product I purchased for breastfeeding. I don't really get to use the stopper and the lid, so I could have gone to a cheaper one without those two. It's really hard to read the values in low light with all those other carvings in this. You can easily collect 1oz in each session or more than that if you are a good producer. This has a good suction. Make sure you don't have much lotion on the breast
customer_reviews.author: Funkyish

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had gotten one sooner. This is so easy to use and to clean. With all the other craziness of caring for a baby, this will make one thing easier. For best use I suction to one breast while nursing on the other during the night and first morning feeding when I’m the most full. Then I gently massage if I want to get a lot out. But if you just suction and leave it, you’ll still get an ounce or two. Only thing is the ounce markings aren’t accurate on mine. It’s .5 ounces off. But not a problem really.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper option but loses suction
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this more affordable version of the Haakaa, but unfortunately it is not comparable. Maybe if I didn’t have a Haakaa, I wouldn’t be as critical, but the suction on this one is not nearly as strong. I have to constantly keep squeezing it everytime it loses suction whereas with the other one, I can walk around without it falling off. Wish I would’ve just spent the extra money and save myself the hassle! On the bright side, I do love the stopper and have not had any leaks with it.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to save milk that would have been wasted
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It catches any milk that would be lost during let down on the side baby is not on during feeding, allowing you to save it and start to build up a supply in your freezer. Be sure to watch a video on how to suction on properly, you need to turn the flange back before suctioning to breast to get the best suction. The little stopper does actually work to keep milk secure and does not allow it to spill. I have actually purchased a second one to keep in the diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: M. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: More milk than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I love My bumblebee pump. Used it three times upon arrival and already pumped out 9 ounces while still trying to figure it out. It’s easy to use once you get the hang of it. It is a bit challenging to use it while nursing but I think With time and practice it will be easier to manipulate with your spare hand. Suction prior to placing it on during the nursing session and viola... the milk will pour out during let down and stimulation. Also, sterilize before first usage. Overall, I’m glad I purchased It and this will be apart of my new gift to new mommies that elect to breastfeed.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla C

customer_reviews.title: Probably good if you have a great milk supply
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this item to help with boosting milk supply when pumping or when feeding my daughter, but since I already struggle to produce much as well as get much out, I didn't have a single bit of success. Even pumping has been a struggle at times. However, judging by how it fit (which was very convenient and comfortable by the way), I think it'd work extremely well for someone with a well-established supply and who let down easily. I've given up on this bulb for now, but I hope to try it again in the future and have better luck another time.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Did not work like more expensive options did
customer_reviews.text: I have used another brand of a suction milk collector, and was excited to pick this one up with the base and cap. It is considerably smaller than the other brand, which I thought would be preferable to keep it out of the way while nursing. Instead, I could never really get it to suction and stay in correctly. When it did suction, it was a weak seal. Unfortunately it didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cobramonkey

customer_reviews.title: Wastes milk
customer_reviews.text: Falls off the boob and spills milk everywhere. I thought it was how I had positioned it but it has done it multiple times. Makes a huge mess and wastes all that breast milk! I would not reccomend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shilo

customer_reviews.title: Must have for breastfeeding moms! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! Im a new mom and got this about 3 days into breast feeding after seeing recommendations in a breastfeeding FB group I’m in, and I honestly don’t know how I made it the first 3 days without it. I use it on the breast I’m not feeding my baby on during feedings, and it catches my let down and pulls some more with the suction it creates. I usually get 2-3oz each time I use it, and alternate breasts each feeding (since my baby gets full on one breast). I recommend this to any breastfeeding mom to save your liquid gold!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: Can't even plump lips
customer_reviews.text: It drew blood. No instructions. Like a leech it drew magic blood from nipple!!! Before milk.... I tried to see if maybe it would be better as a lip plumper...but nahhh!!!!fewy
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfeeding!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: don’t know why i didn’t do this earlier but i just did an Oz comparison to see if this was accurate and it is not. What shows 4oz on the pump is actually only 3oz.. doesn’t really make a difference to me as i store in bottles in the fridge but for others it may! Similar to the haaka but a better price! I nurse on one side and use this pump on the other to catch any let down milk. It’s amazing what I’ve collected and now have a milk stash!! Sometimes I’ll collect 3oz! Must have for all nursing moms... love love!
customer_reviews.author: jax

customer_reviews.title: Helped with engorgement
customer_reviews.text: I packed this in my hospital bag because I figured after the csection my milk might take some time.to come in so this would help stimulate some kind of production. My breasts got super engorged on day 3 but baby and medela pump was hardly getting a few mLs out so this was very helpful. This pump super helped the first few days of engorgment by drawing out the excess milk the electric pump wasnt getting. It was kind of confusing knowing where to squeeze the bottle but tinkering with the positioning got the milk out when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Serrano

customer_reviews.title: great product but inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this, and use it so much that I bought a second one so that I have 2 around the house. Definitely a solid alternative to the haaka. Even though it doesnt have a suction bottom like the haaka, this comes with a lid and stopper, which most haakas dont i believe. My second one hasn't been as great though, it's like the silicone is stiffer than the first one, even after multiple uses and washes, and it often won't stay folded over while trying to put it on, which has been frustrating, have almost spilled milk many times. Would have given 5 stars if my second one was as great as my first one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Even with my milk supply being low I was able to get one ounce my first try with this! As I alternate breastfeeding on each side I can get up to 2 ounces. The suction is great even with the little movement between my babe and I. The quality is beautiful. Fast shipping. I even bought two! Such a great buy I don’t even pump right now and I’m still able to build my freezer stash. I just stick it on then breastfeed on the other side ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Must have for moms that don't respond to pumps well
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and don't respond to a pump but want to help your breasts fully empty to increase supply and also build a stash - this is a MUST have. This is my 3rd son and 3rd time using one of these. The little stopper this time around has saved me SO many tears! I just use it after my 6wo is done nursing each side and am able to get an extra 3oz. A day to put away or give him.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little getting used to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was on vacation and forgot my breast pump. I became so engorged, but this helped relieve the pressure. It's not meant to replace your breast pump, but handy to use if you're in a pinch and can't use your breast pump. Love that it came with the stopper, cap and carrying pouch - a great value. It takes some time getting used to and getting it on correctly, but once you get the hang of it, it's pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Ounces not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as an alternative to the more expensive Haakaa brand name. I believe it works as it should but after reading somewhere that ounces aren’t accurate on off-brands I tested it and confirmed the lines are off by at least a 1/2 ounce. Super disappointed since I’d been slowly building my freezer stash based on these amounts! So 2 months of stored milk have inaccurate amounts written on them. Unfortunately I thought I had more than I actually do since the “1 oz” line is more like .5 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but the markings for the ounces are off
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use at night for when my LO only nurses from one side. It works great, I usually get 1.5-2.5, sometimes 3 oz from it on one breast alone. love that it comes with a bag and two different lids so that I wont spill my milk. Only down side is that the ounce markings are way off. I have to pour it into a medela bottle before storing it so I know how much milk I've actually gotten. This is pretty annoying, but still worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Celina

customer_reviews.title: Must have for breastfeeding mamas!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a MUST for breastfeeding mamas!! I’m not paid or incentivized to write this review, and I don’t write reviews often, but I’m just so over the moon about it, I had to review it. I didn’t expect it to work well but I’m getting a ridiculous amount of breastmilk without pumping or doing any work, just simply placing it on the opposite breast from the one I’m feeding my baby with at each nursing session. I’ve stored so much breastmilk and got rid of my painful engorgement. It stays on and doesn’t irritate like a pump does.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about 2 months now. It has been amazing. I’ve never used the actual Haakaa brand, but i can’t imagine it works any less. I did have issues at first with it staying on, but then found I was placing it wrong. Definitely ensure you look up how to properly attach, I sadly last two oz before realizing. Both stoppers work amazing and do not leak any of your precious breast milk!! Would definitely purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Shipping package was intact and not damaged at all. The product box itself was broken and ripped, and the lid inside was shattered. The pump still works and I will be using it as I needed it at this time, but I am removing stars for a damaged product. The pump itself seems durable and comfortable, so that is why I will be keeping it and the stopper to use while feeding my son.
customer_reviews.author: EBlank

customer_reviews.title: Really handy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great thing to have on hand, especially when your milk first comes in and you need to offload both sides when your baby may only be hungry for one side. My baby is only a week old now, but I know I’ll be making great use of this in the coming months. My one complaint is that the silicone material seems to attract little pieces of lint and fuzz. It’s a minor nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Not a Haakaa
customer_reviews.text: I own a Haakaa pump and I was looking for a cheaper option. This pump works similar, but doesn’t produce like a Haakaa. The suction isn’t as good so it doesn’t cause letdown as well. It tends to come unsuctioned with even little move. The Haakaa I can walk around with baby in arm nursing on one side and it doesn’t come off. This one you need to have at least a hand on it and I would recommend only using it when stationary so you don’t end up with a mess!
customer_reviews.author: Ryenal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great for home & travel!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I bought another one I liked it so much. I have one I keep in the car if I ever need it. I use it it on the opposite side while nursing and catch a lot. If I’m out and about it’s nice to have if I’m engorged! It also helps when my baby is struggling with my let down. I put this on until my let down is over and save that milk to freeze!! Love that it comes with the stopper, lid, and bag for use on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Stephani R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a cheaper, second addition to my Haakaa but this can't even compare... The silicone is significantly thinner and the opening for your nipple is much smaller, resulting in difficulty latching it on and frequently pops off. The smaller opening also makes it difficult to aim the nipple so I frequently found it was blocked and not expressing at all. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Riki

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was EXTREMELY sceptical that this would work since it wasnt a "high end brand" I've honestly never used anything like this. I'm a first time mom so everything is new to me. The suction on this thing is HELLA strong and if positioned right you don't feel it. I like that I can suction cup these bad boys to my bad boys and get things done around the house. I "pump" so much more often with these because of how hands free, bulky pump free, wire and pump cord free it is.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for nursing letdown
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the reason I bought it. Which is mostly just to catch milk letdown on side my daughter isn’t nursing. So I auction and then just let it chill there while she’s nursing other side. I don’t pump at all, and usually get 1-2 ounces. To think that was being wasted before! Easy to clean, love the little heart stopper, which prevents spills(it’s been knocked over)... cute bag, great for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, I’m overproducing and when my milk lets down it’s very forceful. I just suction this on while I nurse my baby on the other side and I catch 3-4 oz that would have otherwise ended up in a nursing pad. I haven’t actually used it as a pump, just to catch leaking milk. My baby then nurses from the side it was on with no issues of not getting enough milk. My baby is 10 days old and I already have a freezer stash built up from using this!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Useful for leaks
customer_reviews.text: I used this to collect milk from my other breast while I’m breastfeeding. I collected about half an oz. it was a little difficult to get it to stick but it suctioned on after a few tries but then I tried to switch breasts and I could not get it to suction. I would recommend this to anyone who leaks while breastfeeding! I also like how it comes with a cute bag and a stopper!
customer_reviews.author: ElaineEvan

customer_reviews.title: Buy it mama!
customer_reviews.text: Omg!! Where have you been all my life! I broke this sucker out and sanitized it as soon as it arrived! Watched an actual haakaa video to figure out how to get the optimum suction and pow! 2oz just like that. This is just while my little one nursed on the other boob . I literally did nothing it just sat there painlessly and worked. I’m so amazed! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy

customer_reviews.title: A must for nursing!!
customer_reviews.text: Ahhhmazing! Such a simple design and so efficient! I can’t believe how effective this little thing works. Particularly effective when your milk comes in and newborn can only eat so much from one side. Gently holds/sucks and collects all the extra for the freezer! Holds tight but gently even on engorged boobs—much more gentle than an electric pump. Must buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick to use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy! Definitely a must have in the diaper bag! We are still working on latching but I'm producing enough for him to bottle feed my milk. So when we stayed a little longer than expected at my MIL's tonight and the little guy had already gone through what we brought to feed him I tried this product out. It was easy and in 5-10 minutes I had a whole meal for my hungry baby! No big equipment needed!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy W.

customer_reviews.title: Genius product
customer_reviews.text: Genius idea for a product! I am exclusively pumping and this device allows me to collect the milk that would have been lost from the opposite breast! Its super easy to use, I even used it in the shower once when I wasn’t leaking breast milk and didn’t want to waste it! Sometimes I toss it in the diaper bag so I can “pump” off a little milk while I’m away somewhere without having to bring my actual pump along!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright idea! just not for me,
customer_reviews.text: I understand how to use it thanks to the instructions, yet I wasn’t able to get more than a couple drops in the container its self and I produce a lot of breast milk. It could be that my breast required more suction power but unfortunately this didnt work to well for me yet I appreciate the idea of the product! Totally useful idea incase of relief on breast!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have built a freezer stash of close to 100 oz from this! It's very easy to use and deffinitly convenient when I'm out and need to catch let down from opposite side baby feeds on. Comes with two ways to seal the milk in. I dont trust the disc cover but the plug is great. I have knocked it over and it didnt spill. The little bag is great to toss in diaper bag and go.
customer_reviews.author: V. Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, really
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful I bought a second one I wish I had these for the five years that I breast-fed my older kids easy to use just make sure you keep squeezing the bulb to compress it to keep the suction going or else it will fall off. Are use them if I’m in gorged from sleeping to take some of the tension off before a baby latches on so she doesn’t get sprayed are use them in the car are use them while nursing her on the other side. Easy to clean and rinse out or put in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Best invention!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best baby products invented in our time! I wish it had been around with my last baby. I used to pump at least once a day which was time consuming and tedious but I can collect 2-3 oz with this each time I nurse and I don’t have to set my baby down somewhere else while I use it. If I just want to collect the leaks, I’ll gently attach it and if I really want to get more milk, I will squeeze it and it provides just enough suction to get a lot more milk out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Make sure to flip it back, squeeze it and place it on, then just flip it onto your boob and it catches every drop. I wouldn’t let it get too full in fear of it detaching and spilling everywhere. It hasn’t happened to me but I read some reviews where that was the case. I mean think of how much milk just goes into the breast pad and goes in the trash. What a waste! Most definitely worth it to invest in this.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylie Senick

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the $14 I spent on it!
customer_reviews.text: I usually get 1-2 ouces with my Bubblebee, which is far more than I expected from such a simple device. I usually get 3-4 ounces per breast with my Medela pump. My baby is 3.5 months old, and I place it on the opposite breast as he nurses. This is such a convenient way to build my frozen milk supply. I love the small size and little pouch, so I can keep it in my diaper bag all the time. I even used it under my shirt when I was stuck in traffic for 2 hours once, and I got about 3.5 ounces that time since it had been a while since I had pumped. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: This product truly changed the game. Breastfeeding is messy, but this little milk collector saved some mess cleaning up. It also helped letdown be easier for the feeding side. I used it very often before I established my milk supply and got milk to store that way. I was happy to not have to pump and wash all those parts and bottles. Loved it so much I recommended to a coworker and even gifted one to my sister. So many new babies. Moms need nifty gadgets too
customer_reviews.author: Xochitl Niave

customer_reviews.title: Not enough suction
customer_reviews.text: SIL bought this and wished she could have returned it. It didnt have enough power even though it was brand new to work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only reason we made it 1 year EBF
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down one of my top finds for baby products. It is so easy and simple to use and clean. I used it every day during our morning feeding from 6 weeks until my daughter was a year. It was amazing what it would catch. I wish I would have found it sooner, would have saved me so much lost milk! I give this to every new mom planning to breastfeed.
customer_reviews.author: Megan E

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly and better than I expected. My first use i got 10ml of letdown! I dont respond the best to mechanical pumps despite owning the best. And to have this little hide-able, small, silent, pain free device to catch my milk is awesome. Squeeze, revers the cone, apply and allow gravity a d steady suction to catch let down while you nurse the opposite breast. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these due to reviews and price but most importantly the lid and heart cover. Ended up return the hakkaa. Honestly like this one better and that's for all the extra pcs they are a total must to prevent spills specially at night or do to lack of sleep 💤 We tend to be a little more clumsy and need all the help
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M

customer_reviews.title: Soft feel and comfortable but maybe better for small chests.. doesn't suction so well!
customer_reviews.text: It's a 4 oz size and it's pretty good! I like the size for sure, but it feels a little lighter than the Haaka and I feel like the suction isn't as strong as the Haaka but I prefer the size and soft feel, just feel like it's not as productive... Not by much though... With the Haaka I get 3 oz during a feeding and with this I get 2 oz... Still would recommend just not the same as Haaka!
customer_reviews.author: ambar

product_meta.title: Bumblebee Manual Breast Pump with Breastfeeding Milk Saver Stopper& lid in Gift Box Food Grade Silicone bpa PVC and Phthalate Free
product_meta.description:
Color:GreenProduct Name: Bumblebee Breast PumpProduct Material: 100% Food Grade SiliconeProduct color: ClearPackage Include: 1 x 90ml Bumblebee Breast pump, 1 x breast Pump Stopper, 1x 90ml breast pump lid , 1 x Instructions, 1 X Package Box ,1 x Green Carry BagProduct Description:The Bumblebee Silicone Breast Pump is a simple way to support breastfeeding. This 100% food grade, eco-friendly and simple to use breast pump will change your breast-feeding life.Our one-piece portable design is easy to use and clean.It fits easily into your handbag or baby bag and requires no hard work. Extremely Soft,Comfortable and Safe, allowing mums to express easily, directly and effectively.Features :
● Small, lightweight and portable.hand-held.

● Accommodates different breast sizes.

● Capacity up to 3.5 ounces/90 ml.

● 100% high quality food grade silicone.

● Extremely Soft,Comfortable and Safe.

● BPA, PVC and phthalates free.

● Safe in dishwashers,microwaves,boiling water and sterilisers.

● Withstand sterilisation's temperature up to 250 degrees celscius.
Breast Pump Instructions for Use:Step 1: Before using the breast pump, make sure it is clean and has been sanitised.Step 2: Using a warm cloth, gently massage your breast in a circular motion to encourage let-down of milk.Step 3:Simple suction to your breast with pump and begin to squeeze gently until you feel suction and milk begins to flow.Step 4: If you are struggling to find a consistent flow,reposition the pump on your breast,moving it around until you find an appropriate suction level that works for you.Step 5: Continue until milk flow slows or your desired amount has been expressed.Step 6: Store milk in the refrigerator for up to three days. Make sure to label your milk with a date
feature_bullets: MOST VALUE MONEY BREATMILK SRORE PUMP - Silicone Breast Pumps to collect breast milk and relieve engorgement using pure natural suction pressure .Recommended by lactation mama and nurses from USA family and Health Presbyterian Hospital.
EXTREMELY SOFT COMFORTABLE AND SAFE - breastmilk breastpump make of food grade silicone,BPA, PVC and Phthalate free,very popular in local mama.

BREASTFEED BABY IN ANY WHERE ANYTIME - 1 set silicone manual breast pump set with 1 Breast Pump Stopper, 1 Dust Cover Lid for breastpumps , 1 Pouch for breast, 1 Box packaging as baby shower gift for newborn mum.

EASY TO USE-Hands-free and save breastmilk during breastfeeding. Very Light and Perfect for travelling. Compared to electric breast pumps ,our breast pump is manual design,no cords, assembly required,use more secure and simple

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,994 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
